citation.article-title: Thiovirga sulfuroxydans gen. nov., sp. nov., a chemolithoautotrophic sulfur-oxidizing bacterium isolated from a microaerobic waste-water biofilm
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thiovirga (Thi.o.vir′ga. Gr. n. thion sulfur; L. fem. n. virga rod; N.L. fem n. Thiovirga sulfur rod).
Motile, obtaining energy from reduced inorganic sulfur compounds.
No anaerobic or heterotrophic growth observed.
Cells store polyphosphate inclusions when grown on sulfide.
Major fatty acids are C16 : 0, C18 : 0, C16 : 1 and C18 : 1.
Member of the γ-Proteobacteria, which is distantly related to halotolerant sulfur-oxidizing bacteria, the members of the genus Halothiobacillus.
The type species is Thiovirga sulfuroxydans.
